episode_title: 723-724 - The One With Chandler and Monica’s Wedding

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you realize this is probably the last time we’ll all be here in the coffee house as six single people?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?! What’s happening to the coffee house?! (Monica looks at her.) Oh! (Realizes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep! From now on its gonna be the four of you guys and me and the mrs. The little woman. The wife. The old ball and chain.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Old?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The young hot ball and chain.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s much better.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op! We gotta go! (The girls stand up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, where are you guys going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re gonna pick up the wedding dress, then we’re gonna have lunch with mom. (Joey stands up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah. Joey, you’re-you’re having lunch with my mom?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I-I just heard lunch. But yeah, I can go. Sure! (They all exit.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know what? Actually I’m kinda glad they’re leaving ‘cause uh, I need to talk to you about something.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well this uh, this may be a little awkward.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, if you want to borrow money, its kind of a bad time. I’m buying dinner for 128 people tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, its…Its not that. Umm, now what I’m going to say to you, I’m not saying as your friend. Okay? I’m-I’m saying as it as Monica’s older brother.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But you’re still my friend?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not for the next few minutes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: During this time…are you, are you still my best man?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do I still call you Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! You guys are getting married tomorrow and-and I couldn’t be more thrilled for both of you, but as Monica’s older brother I-I have to tell you this. If you ever hurt my little sister, if you ever cause her any unhappiness of any kind, I will hunt you down and kick your ass! (Chandler laughs.) What? I’m-I’m-I’m serious! (Chandler laughs harder.) Come—Hey! Dude! Stop it! Okay? I’m-I’m not kidding here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, I hear what your saying, okay? And, thanks for the warning.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No problem.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So are we…friends again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Pause) You won’t believe what Monica’s older brother just said to me!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, the girls are having breakfast.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What‘cha doing Mon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m making a list of all the things that are most likely to go wrong at the wedding. Now, that way I can be prepared.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are they?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, so far I have uh, my bridesmaids’ dresses won’t get picked up, my veil gets lost, or I don’t have my something blue.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Those are all the things I’m responsible for!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I had to go with the odds Rach.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You guys! Remember that audition I had a while ago and didn’t get the part?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The commercial?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That play?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That other play?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The movie?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, that’s the one about the soldiers who fight in World War I!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah! Back then y’know, we called it the Great War. It really was!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well anyway, the guy they wanted backed out and now they want me! I start shooting today!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Congratulations!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait! Wait! Wait! You can’t start today! Today’s the rehearsal dinner!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, I’ll be done by then.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Well then way to go, you big movie star!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! All right, I’ll see you guys over there! I’m off to fight the Nazis.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wait Joey! We fought the Nazis in World War II, not World War I.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! Okay. Yeah well, who-who was in World War I? (Rachel pauses as she thinks.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Go ahead.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re gonna be late! Go! Go! (He runs out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who did we fight in World War I?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mexico?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! Very good.

content.description: Pier 59 Studios, Joey is in costume and standing at the craft services table. He checks his pockets and finds some prop coins in a pouch, which he replaces with some cookies.

content.speaker: The Assistant Director
content.text: Hey Joey! We’re ready.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Me too. (He pats his pocket.)

content.speaker: The Assistant Director
content.text: Richard? We’re ready for you. (Richard approaches.) Joey Tribbiani? This is Richard Crosby, he’s playing Vincent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m doing my scenes with you?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Nice to meet you Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! I can’t believe this! This is incredible. I mean you just won an Oscar!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No I didn’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think you did.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I think I lost. Three times.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh…Cookie?

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Okay! We’re about an hour away from getting the scene lit. So uh, if you guys don’t mind, can we run it a couple of times?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Yeah, sure.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Okay, all right. Let’s do it. (He walks off.) And…Action!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We have to find the rest of the platoon!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Forget the platoon! The platoon is gone! (He is spitting on the hard Ps and Ts.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: The platoon is dead! Face facts Tony!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what are we gonna do?! We have no reinforcements! No-no food!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No, we still have food in the basement! I saw potatoes and some dry pasta!
(Joey wipes his eye.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Hang on a minute! Joey, you keep touching your face. Is something wrong?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. Nope, I uh…I th—I thought it might be kind of a cool character thing. Y’know? He’s uh, he’s a face toucher. (Behind his back, Richard is nodding no.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: I don’t think so. Let’s take it back to Richard’s last line. (Walks off.) Action!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: We may not have any weapons, but we still have food. In the basement I saw potatoes and some dry pasta, and a few tins of tuna! (Joey backs away and wipes his face again.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is standing in the kitchen ready to leave for the rehearsal dinner.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, we gotta go!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Here’s a question you never have to ask. My dad just called and wanted to know if he could borrow one of your pearl necklaces.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t have anything like that, but let me go see if Rachel does.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, include more people in this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, do you realize that at this time tomorrow we’ll be getting married?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute! I have a date tomorrow night.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just, I can’t believe that we made it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well you don’t have to sound so surprised.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry but…nothing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well…honestly ever since we got engaged I have been waiting for something to.. to flip you out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honestly? Me too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Y’know I keep thinking that something stupid is gonna come up and I’ll go all…Chandler. But nothing has.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, I’m so glad. Thank you so much for staying so calm during this. I mean it’s really, it’s made me stay calm. (Chandler just looks at her.) I coulda been worse!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. I’ll be right there.
(She exits and as Chandler picks up his coat, the phone rings and the answering machine gets it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi! If you’re calling before Saturday, you’ve reached Monica and Chandler. But if you’re calling after Saturday, you’ve reached Mr. and Mrs. Bing! Please leave a message for the Bings!
(Chandler freaks out and loosens his tie.)

content.description: The Rehearsal Dinner, Chandler and Monica are greeting guests as they arrive. A woman enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Maureen! (They hug.) Gosh! Hey uh, Chandler? This is my cousin Maureen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re the Bings.
(Phoebe and Rachel walk up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Oh you guys look so beautiful!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mr. and Mrs. Bing! (Walks away.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow Monica! Hey, just so you know I had my uh, older brother chat with Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I…I told him that if he ever hurt you I would hunt him down and kick his ass! (The girls all laugh.) What?! What?! What is the matter with everybody?! I am serious! I would kick his ass! (The laugh harder.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, please! My make-up! (He walks away angrily.)
(Chandler’s Mom enters and Chandler meets her by the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mom. Thanks for wearing something. (They hug.) (She’s wearing a tight dress with a lot of cleavage showing.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh honey! This is so exciting! I thought we screwed you up so bad this day would never come. Oh and just think. Soon there’ll be lots of little Bings. (He freaks out and loosens the tie again.)
(Monica and her parents walk up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mrs. Bing? Here, these are my parents umm, Judy and Jack Geller.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: It’s lovely to meet you.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: So are you his mother or his father?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What?! I’ve never seen one before!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dad! There’s Ross (points), why don’t you go talk to him?
(Mr. and Mrs. Geller start to walk away.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I didn’t even have a chance to act as though I’m okay with it!

content.speaker: Mr. Bing
content.text: Hello all!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi…dad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Mr…Bing.

content.speaker: Mr. Bing
content.text: Nora!

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Charles.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It-it’s so great to see you both here.

content.speaker: Mr. Bing
content.text: Yes! Although, I think we may be seeing a little too much of some people. Aren’t you a little old to be wearing a dress like that?

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Don’t you have a little too much penis to be wearing a dress like that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! (He and Monica walk away.)
[Cut to Mr. and Mrs. Geller talking to Ross.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: …of course you can kick his ass son.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: You could kick anyone’s ass you want to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks you guys. (Walks away happily and his parents smile.)
[Cut to Monica.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Rach! Rach! Umm hey, could you do me a favor and would you talk to Chandler’s dad and try to keep him away from Chandler’s mom?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! But I don’t know what he looks like!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He is the man in the black dress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Man in the black dress… (Monica walks away and Rachel looks around to find a woman in a black dress.) (To her) Hi! I’m Rachel! I’m a friend of Monica and Chandler’s!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I’m Amanda.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I get it! A…man…duh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can I have everyone’s attention please? I’m uh; I’m Ross Geller.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Doctor Ross Geller.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad…dad, please! As I was saying umm, I’m Dr. Ross Geller. Uhh, and I’m the best man. And uh, this marriage is doubly special for me umm, because not only is the groom my best friend but uh, the bride is my little sister. And, she’s the greatest sister a guy could ask for. So if you’d all please join me in raising a glass to the, the couple we’re here to celebrate. (Everyone does so.) To the Bings.

content.speaker: All
content.text: To the Bings!
(Everyone clinks glasses and Chandler freaks out again.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I’m gonna go steam my wedding dress okay? Who wants the responsibility of making sure nothing happens to it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who wants it? Anybody?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I said I’ll do it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nobody wants to do it? All right, I’ll do it myself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica! I’m not gonna screw it up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? You’re right, I’m sorry. Actually you were a big help tonight. Yeah, and thanks for putting my grandmother in the cab and making sure she got to the hotel safely.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well of course that is what I’m here for!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. Sorry. (Monica goes into the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! (To Phoebe) What grandmother?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey is wearing sunglasses and as he exits his bedroom, Ross enters the apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Where have you been?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, taking my parents back to the hotel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Are you going back to work?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nice shades.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks. Yeah, I figure if I wear these in my scenes at least I won’t get spit in the eyes, y’know?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And if I remember correctly, Ray Ban was the official sponsor of World War I!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! All right. I’ll see you later. (He starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, where’s Chandler?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, I think he’s in Rachel’s room. See ya. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler? (He opens the door and looks inside and doesn’t see him.) Chandler? (He checks the bathroom and still doesn’t find him. He then finds a note on the counter. He picks it up and reads it.)
content.parenthetical: going up to Rachel’s closed door

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe and Rachel are in the kitchen as there is a knock on the door. Rachel answers it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is uh, is Monica here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’s steaming her dress, why? What’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think Chandler’s gone. (He hands her the note.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He left that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Tell Monica I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s up? (Rachel hands her the note and she reads it.) Tell Monica I’m sorry. (Pause) Tell her yourself!

content.description: The Hallway, Ross, Phoebe, and Rachel are discussing the note.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Chandler just left though!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah but, maybe it’s not what we think. Maybe it’s tell Monica I’m sorry I…drank the last of the milk.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or maybe he-he was writing to tell her that-that he’s changed his name, y’know? Tell Monica I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think it means he freaked out and left!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t be so negative! Good God! Isn’t it possible that Sorry is sitting in there (Joey and Rachel’s apartment) right now?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Phoebe, I-I think Ross is right. What are we gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look—Okay, I’m just gonna—I’m gonna have to go find him and bring him back! Okay? You-you make sure Monica does not find out, okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay but if you don’t find him and bring him back, I am gonna hunt you down and kick your ass!
(Ross laughs and Phoebe points harder.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I will, I will find him.

content.description: The Movie Set, Joey is getting his make-up touched up as Richard approaches.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Hey Joey, could you uh, go through these lines with me? (He’s holding a script.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh man! They-they just redid my make-up!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Just the last two pages.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright.
(They go onto the set.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I found the picture!
(He’s still spitting and Joey holds his script in front of his face.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Picture? What picture?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Could you uh, could you lower your script? I need to see your face so I can uh, play off your reaction.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay uh, look I know you’re a great actor, okay? And you play all those Shakespeare guys and stuff…

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, thanks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you’re spittin’ all over me man!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well of course I am!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know you’ve been spitting on me?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: That’s what real actors do! Annunciation is the mark of a good actor! And when you enunciate, you spit! (Spits on the t)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! Didn’t know that.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks! Okay-okay check it out! (Reading from the script) Picture? What picture? (He pauses then spits) Eh?

content.description: Central Perk, Gunther is behind the counter as Ross enters looking for Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gunther have you uh, have you seen Chandler?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: No. No, I haven’t seen him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh damn!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: He’s getting married tomorrow, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes. Yes. Don’t worry. Everything’s fine. We’ll uh, we’ll see you tomorrow at the wedding.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I wasn’t invited.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well then, we’ll-we’ll see you the day after tomorrow. (Walks away slowly, but notices something.) Mom?! Dad?! (They’re sitting by the window.) What-what…what you guys doing here?!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Well, you kids talk about this place so much, we thought we’d see what all the fuss is about.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I certainly see why the girls like coming here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: The sexy blonde behind the counter. (She waves at Gunther who waves back.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Gunther?!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Your mother just added him to her list.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Your-your list?

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Yeah, the list that—of people we’re allowed to sleep…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! No-no! I know, I know what the list is! Mom! Look if you see Chandler, could you just let him know I’m looking for him?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: And if you see Rita Moreno, let her know I’m looking for her.
(Ross points at him and exits.)

content.description: The Movie Set, Richard and Joey are doing a scene.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Action!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I found the picture!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What picture?!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: The picture of my wife! In your pack!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You went through my personal property?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Why do have a picture of Paulette in your pack?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Because Vincent, we were lovers. (Pause) For two years!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Cut! Wonderful!
(Joey and Richard both wipe their faces and are given towels.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great scene yeah?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh you’re awesome! And, in that last speech? You soaked me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks a lot.

content.speaker: The Assistant Director
content.text: Here’s your call sheet for tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m-I’m not working tomorrow.

content.speaker: The Assistant Director
content.text: You are now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! I can’t! You gotta get me out of it! I’ve got plans! (Spits.) Important plans! (Spits on the Ps.)
(The AD walks away wiping his face.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, the next morning, Rachel and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross said there’s still no word from Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh but he did say that they found the grandmother wandering down fifth avenue.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Well there’s one down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m getting married today!!! (She trips and falls.) (Getting up) I think I just cracked a rib. But I don’t care because today’s my wedding day! My day is finally here!! (Runs back into her room.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know she might not even notice he’s gone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna start getting ready! (Goes back into her room.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God! Don’t—We can’t let her start getting ready! This is too awful! Oh God, but wait she’ll be in the gown and then he won’t show up and then she’s gonna have to take off the gown…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shhh! Stop it! Stop it Rachel! You can’t do this here! (She drags her into the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. It’s just…It’s just so sad!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but you’ve got to pull yourself together! Monica can’t see you like this! Then she’ll know something’s wrong!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. I know. Oh God. (Looking around) There’s no tissue! Can you grab me some toilet paper?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. (Looks.) Oh, that’s gone too. This is Monica’s bathroom right?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No-no! I-I…I found one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(Phoebe reaches into the trash can, pulls one out, and hands it to Rachel.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thank you! (Wiping her nose.) Oh God! (She throws it out.) Can I have another one?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure. (Reaching into the trash can.) Do you need some floss? (Grabs a piece of it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God I just cannot imagine what is gonna happen if Chandler doesn’t show up!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh here’s a whole bunch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I mean she’s gonna be at the wedding waiting for him and people will be whispering, “Oh that poor girl.” Y’know? Then she’ll have to come back here and live all alone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!
content.parenthetical: finding something interesting in the trash can

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There was a pregnancy test in the garbage, and it’s positive. Monica’s pregnant. (Rachel covers her mouth.) So I guess she won’t be totally alone.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s bathroom, the scene is continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! Monica’s gonna have a baby! Hey, can this count as her something new?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, do you think this is why Chandler took off?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, she had to have just taken that test because I took out the trash last night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh God, this is turning into the worst wedding day ever! The bride is pregnant. The groom is missing. And I’m still holding this. (She throws the test back into the trash.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Phoebe, we cannot tell anyone about this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay. Hey, wait. Do you know what kind of birth control she was using?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Just for the future, this is hardly a commercial for it.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Ross is just hanging up the phone as Rachel and Phoebe enter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anything?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! I talked to Joey on the set, he hasn’t heard from him. I-I-I talked to Chandler’s parents again!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You told them he was missing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! I made it seem like I was just calling to chat. Pretty sure, they both think I’m interested in them.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, we’ve got to tell her he’s gone. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! Hey! Hey! We can’t!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, she’s gonna start getting ready soon!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, can’t you at least stall her a little? I’ll-I’ll go back to some of the places I went last night.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, well how much time do you need?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well how much time before she absolutely has to start getting ready?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: One hour.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Give me two.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then why do you ask?!
(They all go into the hallway.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, wish me luck.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. I’m going with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, you’re tired. You’ve been looking all night. And clearly you suck at this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I’ll see you guys later.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Wait, do you know how you’re going to stall her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll figure something out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Good luck.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks.
(Phoebe and Ross go to look for Chandler and Rachel enters Monica and Chandler’s.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Okay, so I thought we’d start with my make up and then do my hair.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay uh, but before you do that. I-I, I need you to talk to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm… I’m never gonna getting married!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah you will! The right guy is just around the corner! Okay, are we done with that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Monica! I’m serious! Oh, maybe I should just forget about it. Become a lesbian or something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Any woman would be lucky to have ya.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well maybe it would make me feel better if I slept with Joey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel! You okay?

content.description: The Movie Set, Joey is reporting for work.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excuse me, Aaron? (The director turns around.) Hi! Umm, I have a little problem with the schedules. Originally, I wasn’t supposed to work today, and I have this wedding that I really have to be at. It’s my best friend’s, and I’m officiating so I really can’t work past four.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Joey, you gotta stay until the end. We can’t stop filming just for you. It’s not like it’s your wedding. (Starts to walk away.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m having surgery!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I-I just made up the stuff about the wedding because I didn’t want you to worry about me. But, I’m having surgery today.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: What kind of surgery?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Transplant.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: But you’re supposed to work on Monday.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hair transplant.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: But you’re not bald.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not on my head.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Look Joey, there’s nothing I can do. Besides, you’re probably gonna be out by four anyway. We’ve just got one short scene. It’s just you and Richard, and God knows he’s a pro. You’ll be fine. (Walks away and sees Richard entering.) Morning Richard.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You’re here! Great! Great! Great! Let’s get going buddy, we’ve got a scene to shoot!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: I’m wearing two belts.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you drunk?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes you are!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: All right.

content.description: A Street, Phoebe and Ross are exiting a pizza place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We are never gonna find him! He’s one guy in a huge city!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Is that him? (She points at someone.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is an old, Chinese woman!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He could be in disguise, y’know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aw, y’know…Y’know, maybe we’re-we’re just approaching this all wrong. If you’re Chandler and-and you wanna hide, where is the last place on Earth people would think you’d go?
[Cut to an office building.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So this is your office?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How did you guys find me? I knew I should’ve hid at the gym!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What the hell are you doing?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Panicking! And using the Internet to try to prove that I’m related to Monica. How is she?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s fine. She doesn’t know you’re gone. And she doesn’t have to know, okay? Now come on, we’re going home.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! No! I can’t do that!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why not?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because if I go home, we’re gonna become the Bings! I can’t be the Bings!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s wrong with being the Bings?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The Bings have horrible marriages! They yell. They fight. And they use the pool boy as a pawn in their sexual games!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler, have you ever put on a black cocktail dress and asked me up to your hotel room?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then you are neither of your parents!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not just their marriage! I mean, look at yours. Look at everybody’s! The only person that can make marriage work is Paul Newman! And I’ve met me; I am not Paul Newman. I don’t race cars! I don’t make popcorn! None of my proceeds go to charity.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But look Chandler, right now no-one has a lower opinion of you than I do. But I totally believe you can do this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I want to. I love her so much, but I’m afr…It’s too huge.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, okay. You’re right. It is huge. So why don’t we take it just a little bit at a time? Okay? Umm, forget getting married for a sec; just forget about it. Can you just come home and take a shower?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well yeah, but then…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah—No-but-but-but-but! We’re just gonna go home and take a shower. Now, that’s not scary right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Depends on what you mean by we.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel is still trying to stall Monica.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The nights are the hardest. (Checks her watch.) But then the day comes! And that’s every bit as hard as the night. And then the night comes again…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The days and nights are hard! I get it! Okay? Look umm, Rachel I’m sorry! I have to start getting ready! I’m getting married today!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. At dusk. That’s such a hard time for me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m gonna go put my make-up on, we have to be at the hotel in an hour! (Starts for the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. But wait!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let’s go to lunch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t go to lunch!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right.
(Monica goes into the bathroom and Rachel thinks quickly.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh good God! I’ve fallen down! (She trips and falls.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Alright. (Gets up.) Honey listen. When I tell you what I’m about to tell you, I need you to remember that we are all here for you and that we love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, you’re-you’re really freaking me out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We can’t find Chandler…(Phoebe sticks her head and motions that they found Chandler)—‘s vest. We can’t find Chandler’s vest.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How can that be?! Oh wait! Wait! Are you, are you serious?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Found the vest! I mean we’re gonna have to keep an eye on it, y’know make sure we don’t lose it again…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wow! Okay. Don’t scare me like that okay? I mean for a minute there I was like, “Oh my God! The worst has happened!”
(Monica goes into the bathroom and Phoebe and Rachel breathe a sigh of relief.)

content.description: The Movie Set, Joey and Richard are in the middle of a scene. They are both holding swords.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I would sooner die in this hellhole then see her back with you!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: That can be arranged.
(Richard thrusts, misses Joey by several feet and Joey screams in pain and drops to his knees.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Let’s reset.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! He got me! Owwwwww!!!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Let’s take it from there.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Are you a little off today? It’s going terribly slowly.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, my best friends are getting married in like an hour. Okay? And I’m the minister. Please! Please! Can you pull it together?

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Of course! I’m-I’m sorry. I-I’d hate you to miss anything like that on account of me. I can do this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you. Thank you.

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Still rolling, annnnd action!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I would sooner die in this hellhole then see her back with you!

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Now, that can be arranged! (He brings his sword back and drops it, causing it to fly over the wall.) Slippery little bugger!

content.description: The Hotel, Monica’s room, Mr. and Mrs. Bing are staring at each other while Phoebe looks on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So-so you two were married huh? What happened? You just drift apart?
(Rachel and Mrs. Geller enter.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Here comes the bride.
(Monica enters wearing her wedding dress.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanna wear this everyday.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You look so beautiful.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so happy for me.
(The phone rings and Rachel answers it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Did Chandler show up yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, we got him back. Everything’s fine.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Damnit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Why? Where are you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m still on the set!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey! The wedding is in less than an hour!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! I’m sorry! The guy’s drunk, they won’t let me go until we get this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! I’m gonna have to find another minister.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No, I’m the minister! Alright, look-look, put ‘em both on the phone, I’ll marry them right now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! Joey, I have to go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Don’t you hang up on me! I’ll marry you and me right now! I have the power!
(She hangs up anyway.)

content.description: Chandler’s Hotel Room, Ross is getting Chandler ready.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There you go. You put on a tuxedo! Now that wasn’t so scary, was it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m telling you, just a little bit at a time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah okay. Well, what’s the next little bit?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Getting married. (Chandler panics.) Okay. Okay. You can, you can do that too! Just like you’ve done everything else!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. You’re right. Hey I-I can do that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, excuse me for a minute. (Starts to leave)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh—Hey—Whoa-whoa, where, where you going?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross, I am not gonna run away again! I just want to get a little fresh air.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(Chandler goes out into the hall and lights up a cigarette.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh fresh air!
(He hears Phoebe and Rachel coming and hides in the ice machine room.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait! Maybe, maybe you’re overreacting! You do that y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well Phoebe, we gotta do something! (They turn the corner.) Well, y’know. I mean there’s no way Joey’s gonna make it in time. So I’m gonna go through the hotel and see if there’s any other weddings going on.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Oh but don’t tell them Monica’s pregnant because they frown on that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.
(They head in separate directions and Chandler emerges and he’s so shocked that his cigarette is hanging from his lip.)

content.description: The Hotel, Rachel is walking through the ballroom area and comes upon the sign for the Anastassakis/Papasifakis wedding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Anastassakis/Papasifakis wedding, excellent! {It’s a good thing Jennifer Aniston is Greek, because she had to pronounce those names. Luckily for me, they were written on a sign.}(The happy couple emerges.) Congratulations. (To the best man and maid of honor) Mazel Tov! (The rabbi emerges.) Hi! Oh, great hat. (He’s wearing an interesting hat and she takes him over to talk.) Listen umm, I need you to perform another wedding. Can you do that?

content.speaker: The Rabbi
content.text: I don’t know. Are they Greek Orthodox?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Yeah. They’re…they’re-they’re my friends, uh, Monica Stephanopolus and uh, and Chandler Acidofolus.

content.description: Monica’s Hotel Room, Chandler and Monica’s parents and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! (To Mrs. Bing) Hi! (Mr. Bing starts rubbing his arm.) Hi. Has umm, anyone seen Chandler?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I thought he was with you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He-he was with me umm, we’re playing a little game, y’know? Hide and seek.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: You can’t ask us son, that’s cheating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right, thanks for keeping me honest dad.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Well, he better not come by here. He can’t see the bride in the wedding dress.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: As I recall when we got married, I saw the groom in the wedding dress.

content.speaker: Mr. Bing
content.text: But that was after the wedding, it’s not bad luck then.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Honey, it isn’t good luck.
(Monica enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know! Hey, how’s Chandler doin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great. He’s doing great. Don’t you worry about Chandler.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you’re-you’re sweating.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: These-these are beads of joy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s sweet. Don’t touch me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh Phoebe, can I see you for a second?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!
(They both go out into the hall.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Chandler’s gone again!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! Why would you play hide and seek with someone you know is a flight risk?!
(Ross just glares at her.)

content.description: The Movie Set, Joey is walking up to the director, pleading with him to let him go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aaron! You gotta let me go. The guy’s hammered!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: I’m sorry Joey, as long as he’s here and he’s conscious we’re still shooting.
(He walks away and Joey does Ross’s fist thing. He then enters Richard’s dressing room, to find Richard cutting his steak with his sword.)

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: You wouldn’t happen to have a very big fork?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I uh, I just talked to the director. That’s it, we’re done for the day.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Well have we finished the scene?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! You…you were wonderful.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: As were you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I got your car, it’s right outside.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Why? Are we done for the day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s what you told me.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Oh, thank you. You’re welcome. (He stands up, staggers to the couch, and starts to lie down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no! We gotta go! Come on! (Joey picks him up in a fireman’s carry and carries him out.) Here we go.

content.speaker: Richard
content.text: Is that my ass? (He’s looking at Joey’s.)
(And as Joey walks out the door, Richard grabs a bottle of Scotch, just as the door closes and carries it with him.)

content.description: The Hotel, Phoebe and Ross are looking for Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There he is!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?
(Ross runs over and tackles him.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Oh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re not getting away this time mister! Unless you want that ass kicking we talked about!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross! (He starts to get up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hiiii-Ya!! (Chandler lies back down.) I’m serious! You’re not walking out on my sister!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s right! I’m not!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then where the hell have you been?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know about Monica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I heard you and Rachel talking.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! What?! Talking about what?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t know?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Know what—If somebody doesn’t tell me what’s going on right now…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? You’ll hi-ya?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica’s pregnant.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God. Oh my God! And you’re-you’re…you’re not freaking out?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I was! Then I went down to the gift shop because I was out of cigarettes…

content.speaker: Phoebe and Ross
content.text: Cigarettes?!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Big picture please! So I was in the gift shop, and that’s when I uh, saw this. (He holds up a little, tiny baby jumper that reads I (heart) New York.) Yeah, y’know what? I thought anything that can fit into this, can’t be scary.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well you obviously didn’t see Chucky 3.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But come on, look at how cute and small this is! So I got it to give Monica so she’d know I was okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude. (Hugs him.)
(Mr. Geller turns the corner.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Way to go son! I knew you’d find him!

content.description: [Scene: The moment we waited for has finally arrived. It’s time for Monica and Chandler’s wedding. We’ve got violins playing Every Breath You Take, we’ve got guests seated, and Chandler starts walking down the aisle with his parents on either arm.]

content.speaker: Mr. Bing
content.text: Our little boy is getting married.

content.speaker: Mrs. Bing
content.text: Oh look at you! So handsome!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You look beautiful mom. (His dad clears his throat.) You look beautiful too dad. I love you both. (He kisses his dad on the cheek) I’m so glad you’re here. (He kisses his mom.)
(He walks up onto the altar and notices the rabbi.)

content.speaker: The Rabbi
content.text: Are you Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you Joey?
(Ross walks down the aisle with Phoebe and Rachel on his arms.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh. This is nice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve never walked down the aisle knowing it can’t end in divorce.
(Finally, Monica with her parents on her arms start down the aisle.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh I wish your grandmother had lived to see this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s right there.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Not that old crow, my mother. (They stop and she kisses Monica on the cheek.) Congratulations darling.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: I love you sweetheart. (He kisses her and they sit down.)
(Chandler steps off the altar to greet his bride-to-be.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You look beautiful. Is this new? (Her dress.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(They both step up onto the altar and she notices the rabbi.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who is this?

content.speaker: The Rabbi
content.text: I am Father Kalebasous.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s Greek Orthodox.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: As are you…

content.speaker: The Rabbi
content.text: Let us begin. Dearly beloved…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s my line! (He walks up the aisle and to the rabbi) I can take it from here, thanks. (To all) Dearly beloved, I’m sorry I’m a little late. You may be confused by this now, (He’s still in costume) but you won’t be Memorial Day weekend 2002. Well, let’s get started before the groom takes off again. Huh? (Monica is shocked and looks around.) We are gathered here today, to join this man and this woman in the bonds of holy matrimony. I’ve known Monica and Chandler for a long time, and I can not imagine two people more perfect for each other. And now, as I’ve left my notes in my dressing room, we shall proceed to the vows. Monica?
(She turns to get her vows from Rachel.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He took off?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Go on! Go on. (She turns back to Chandler.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, for so long I…I wondered if I would ever find my prince, my soul mate. Then three years ago, at another wedding I turned to a friend for comfort. And instead, I found everything that I’d ever been looking for my whole life. And now…here we are…with our future before us…and I only want to spend it with you, my prince, my soul mate, my friend. Unless you don’t want to. You go!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler?
(Ross leans in to give Chandler his vows.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, that’s okay. (Ross nods and retreats.) Monica I thought this was going to be the most difficult thing I ever had to do. But when I saw you walking down that aisle I realized how simple it was. I love you. Any surprises that come our way, it’s okay, because I will always love you. You are the person I was meant to spend the rest of my life with. You wanna know if I’m sure? (He leans in and kisses her.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You may not kiss the bride. So, I guess by the powers vested in me by the state of New York and the Internet guys, I now pronounce you husband and wife. Oh wait! Do you take each other?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I do.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah you do!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rings?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aw crap! Okay—uh…uh let’s-let’s do the rings.
(Chandler and Monica both turn, take the rings from Ross and Rachel respectively, and place them on each other’s fingers.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We good? Yeah? Good? Once again, I pronounce you husband and wife. (To Chandler) Now kiss her again.
(They kiss and everyone applauds.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I love you. And I know about the baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What baby?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Our baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We have a baby?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe found your pregnancy test in the trash.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I didn’t take a pregnancy test.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then…who did?
[Cut to Phoebe and Rachel.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh and they’re gonna have a baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.
(The camera zooms in on Rachel who has a very worried and frightened look on her face and she slowly takes a deep breath.)
[Fade to black.]
{Transcriber’s Note: There was no trailer for this episode. See you in season 8; which will start this fall.}
